children.text: The benchtop damage has been badly repaired, which looks poorly finished and needs to be rectified.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 10.07 Rectification of defective natural materials and manufactured materials states that
‘The rectification of surfaces is defective if the rectification work does not reasonably match the adjacent areas. If reasonable matching is not possible, the entire surface shall be replaced’ .
The benchtop in this area should be replaced in accordance with above.
